answers.answer: Because of your age and the fact that you have type 1 diabetes mellitus it is very likely that you are in fact experiencing chest  pain related to obstructive atherosclerosis. You need urgent medical assistance and be placed on good anti anginal therapy including aspirin, beta blockers, ace inhibitors and will most likely need a left heart catherization to see if you have severe coronary blockages.

hospitals are donated millions of dollars each year which are used to help people without insurance.  besides, most hospitals will let you pay your bill in monthly installments, as little as $5 a month sometimes!i think the doctor is right!  you should seek immediate treatment.

question: I am a 43 year old type 1 diabetic which I have had for over 35 years. I am not over weight, but lately I have been having a tightness in my chest, I will at times get light headed and kinda dizzy, and at times my heart seems to  be beating fast and it kinda hurts. I have no insurance so I really can'y just run to the dr. if it is nothing but getting old. Do anyone have any clues?? Thanks
title: fast heart rate
